body:
@MKiselev i think it would be better if the migration mechanism gets the primary key field directly from the database of the given table instead of an extra parameter to foreignKey
Extra parameter would be best for cases where the corresponding field in the foreign table is not the primary key of the table
@tsanchev the mechanism of creating migration nowhere use the database component, so I think members unlikely to support the idea.

There are 2 ways of solving the problem:
1. Specify FK column as parameter.
2. Get FK column from DB (that would require querying existing schema).
These two could be combined. If key isn't specified, get it from DB.

issue.title: Issue #12748 fix
